title: 'Just push us into the sea': The frustration of an area failed by politics
partialText: In Horden, County Durham, Westminster slogans have long been left unmet as the population has plummeted.

title: Plan to increase youth minimum wage could be delayed
partialText: Government sources tell BBC News they could slow down plans to make minimum wage equal across age groups.

title: William says it has taken 'long time to understand my emotions'
partialText: Prince William has offered his advice to those struggling with their mental health, in a special Radio 1 panel discussion.

title: Climber on trial for leaving girlfriend to die on Austria's highest mountain
partialText: Kerstin G's boyfriend is accused of leaving her unprotected and exhausted close to the summit during a blizzard.

title: Benfica midfielder denies racially abusing Vinicius after Real Madrid match halted
partialText: The Champions League match between Real Madrid and Benfica was halted for 10 minutes, with both sets of players leaving the pitch.

title: Under pressure from Trump, Venezuela's new president has aces up her sleeve
partialText: Delcy Rodriguez knows its in America's interests for her to be a success

title: Firm assessing Covid vaccine harm replaced after costs spiral to £48m
partialText: The figure paid to Crawford & Company Adjusters is eight times the original estimate for the work.

title: US says 'meaningful progress' made as Ukraine talks enter second day
partialText: The US special envoy struck an optimistic note after the first day of talks in Geneva, but hopes for a breakthrough remain low.

title: I invested £12,000 in Brewdog  - I think I've lost it all
partialText: More than 200,000 people bought Equity for Punks shares in the craft brewer but many now believe they are worthless.

title: Child abuse increasing and more complex to police, crime agency says
partialText: Police cannot tackle the issue alone, the NCA says, and technology companies must do more.

title: Snow and rain warnings in force as cold snap continues
partialText: The Met Office says there could be some flooding and disruption to travel.

title: The 61-year-old Glaswegian whose ice rink moonwalk went viral
partialText: Mark Callan has gone viral for his on-ice antics. But who is he and how did he end up at the Winter Olympics?

title: GB curlers on brink of early exit after Canada defeat
partialText: Team GB's Winter Olympics curling medal hopes are now in serious jeopardy after Bruce Mouat's world champions were beaten 9-5 by Canada in Cortina.

title: Nine medals up for grabs - Wednesday's guide
partialText: What's happening and who to look out for at the 2026 Winter Olympics in Milan-Cortina.

title: I would scream in my sleep: Women from Syria's Alawite minority tell of kidnap and rape
partialText: The BBC hears harrowing accounts of assaults appearing to target the sect of former President Assad.

title: 'He did it for us': US soldier recalls Jesse Jackson's efforts to free him and two other POWs
partialText: In 1999, Jesse Jackson flew to Yugoslavia to help free three US soldiers captured during the Kosovo War.

title: I used to hate my appearance. Here's how I learned to accept it
partialText: Tilly and Charlotte share their experiences of body dysmorphic disorder and how they recovered from it.

title: The Papers: 'Pressure piles on Andrew' and 'Jesse Jackson dies at 84'
partialText: Police accessing information from Stansted Airport private flights over Epstein ties leads a number of papers today.

title: Ros Atkins on...unanswered Andrew questions
partialText: The BBC's Analysis Editor Ros Atkins looks at the questions around the way Buckingham Palace has responded to the various accusations against the King's brother.

title: Food prices are surging in Russia. Is the war hitting Russians in the pocket?
partialText: Russia's economy is hanging between stagnation and decline, and ordinary Russians are beginning to feel the pinch.

title: 'I do not trust them' - top streamers left concerned by Discord age checks
partialText: The platform's plan to roll out global age checks has caused concern in streaming communities.

title: Police assessing Stansted Airport private flights over Epstein ties
partialText: Essex Police says it is assessing information in relation to private flights into and out of the airport.

title: Third Briton dies in French Alps avalanches in one week
partialText: A total of 28 people have died in avalanches since the start of the winter season in the French Alps.

title: No DNA matches on glove found in Nancy Guthrie case, police say
partialText: But the sheriff tells the BBC he is confident they will find the missing woman -  whether it takes days, months "or worse".

title: Illegal skin lightening cream being sold in UK butchers, watchdog warns
partialText: A trade body has warned illegal skin bleaching products are being sold in an increasingly wide range of places.

title: TfL advert banned for harmful racial stereotype
partialText: The Facebook advert shows a black teenager verbally harassing a young girl alongside a white friend.

title: 'It's overwhelming': Plastic from 1960s Canada washes up on Orkney beach
partialText: One litter picker says he has seen a huge increase in the amount of plastic washing up on Sanday this year.

title: US says it supports UK Chagos Islands deal
partialText: US Department of State says it supports the UK's decision to "proceed with its agreement with Mauritius concerning the Chagos archipelago".

title: BBC News app
partialText: Top stories, breaking news, live reporting, and follow news topics that match your interests

title: Is There A Gen Z Jobs Crisis?
partialText: Youth unemployment hits a more than 10 year high.

title: Will the US Supreme Court stand up to Trump?
partialText: Or will the court expand the US president’s power?

title: 'Cowards' - Vinicius speaks out as Benfica deny racism claims
partialText: The Champions League match between Real Madrid and Benfica was halted for 10 minutes, with both sets of players leaving the pitch.

title: What do curlers do when they're not at the Olympics?
partialText: Lifting weights like sprinters, strategising like chess players, and fuelling like Tour de France cyclists, the life of a Team GB curler.

title: 'Absolutely stunning!' Norway's Frostad wins 'best big air final of all-time'
partialText: Austria's Matej Svancer, USA's Mac Forehand, and Norway's Tormod Frostad compete for the medals with the final three runs of a spectacular men's freestyle skiing big air final.
